title: Holiday Flagship Early-Access & Pop-up Tests
highlights: Unified targets: **10–15%** footfall uplift (stretch **≥25%**), **20–30%** early-window transaction share, event CPA ≤**0.80×**, QR redemption **≥5%** of footfall
A/B framing: Arm A = legacy markdown vs Arm B = bundle + GWP + loyalty inside same two-week window to isolate margin and conversion effects
Operational focus: opening-weekend loyalty push, BNPL/cashback follow-up, instrumented door counts and QR→POS linkage for 8-week cohort measurement
executive_summary: This program pairs early-access windows with pop-up activations to hit the unified holiday target pack—**detectable foot-traffic uplift 10–15% (stretch goal ≥25% in top markets)**, **early-window transaction share 20–30% (vs ~12–15% baseline)**, **event CPA ≤0.80× baseline**, and **QR/scan redemption ≥5% of footfall**.[^3][^4][^1] The test is framed as an A/B inside the same two‑week window: Arm A runs legacy markdowns while Arm B offers bundles + GWP + loyalty enrollment to determine which approach drives earlier conversion and better post-visit economics.[^2][^1] In the **next 30 days** collaboration teams must finalize the A/B creative and measurement plan, instrument door counts and QR→POS links, secure BNPL/cashback and GWP logistics, schedule opening‑weekend staffing and post‑visit outreach, and lock analytics for eight‑week cohort tracking.[^4][^3]
top_operator_moves: Prioritize an opening‑weekend loyalty acquisition push and measure loyalty sign‑ups vs. raw footfall for Nov 15–16 to capture high intent.[^3][^4]
Schedule a 7‑day post‑visit targeted outreach (Nov 23–29) layering BNPL/cashback incentives for pop‑up visitors to drive conversion into tracked loyalty.[^4][^1]
Execute the Arm A vs Arm B A/B (legacy markdown vs bundle+GWP+loyalty) with CPA and early-window share as primary KPIs and 8‑week cohort retention as the secondary KPI.[^2][^3]
